agent_diff:
diff --git a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py
index 2e4a7634ef..d5c1d8a4e2 100644
--- a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py
+++ b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py
@@ -203,3 +203,27 @@ try:
     pass
 except* (BaseException, Exception, ValueError) as e:
     pass
+
+# Parentheses must be preserved when tuple contains starred expressions
+# Without parentheses, `except *exceptions:` is exception group syntax,
+# not a tuple with a starred element
+try:
+    pass
+except (*exceptions,):
+    pass
+
+try:
+    pass
+except (ValueError, *other_exceptions):
+    pass
+
+try:
+    pass
+except (*exceptions, ValueError):
+    pass
+
+# Also applies to except*
+try:
+    pass
+except* (*exceptions,):
+    pass
diff --git a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs
index cfe5f9151e..dd125b60b0 100644
--- a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs
+++ b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs
@@ -78,9 +78,15 @@ impl FormatNodeRule<ExceptHandlerExceptHandler> for FormatExceptHandlerExceptHan
                         // except BaseException, Exception:  # Ok
                         //     ...
                         // ```
+                        //
+                        // However, parentheses must be preserved if the tuple contains a starred
+                        // expression, as removing them would change the semantics:
+                        // - `except (*exceptions,):` is a tuple with a starred element
+                        // - `except *exceptions:` is exception group syntax
                         Some(Expr::Tuple(tuple))
                             if f.options().target_version() >= PythonVersion::PY314
-                                && name.is_none() =>
+                                && name.is_none()
+                                && !tuple.elts.iter().any(|elt| matches!(elt, Expr::Starred(_))) =>
                         {
                             write!(
                                 f,

ground_truth_diff:
diff --git a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py
index 2e4a7634ef..7ce45a226b 100644
--- a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py
+++ b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/resources/test/fixtures/ruff/statement/try.py
@@ -203,3 +203,16 @@ try:
     pass
 except* (BaseException, Exception, ValueError) as e:
     pass
+
+
+# Regression tests for https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff/issues/23125
+# Parentheses cannot be removed if any of the tuple elements is starred
+try:
+    pass
+except (Exception, *exceptions):
+    pass
+
+try:
+    pass
+except (*exceptions, Exception):
+    pass
diff --git a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs
index cfe5f9151e..bcb9720329 100644
--- a/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs
+++ b/crates/ruff_python_formatter/src/other/except_handler_except_handler.rs
@@ -78,9 +78,30 @@ impl FormatNodeRule<ExceptHandlerExceptHandler> for FormatExceptHandlerExceptHan
                         // except BaseException, Exception:  # Ok
                         //     ...
                         // ```
+                        //
+                        // Unless any component of the tuple is starred. This case is actually valid
+                        // syntax on its own but is parsed as `except*`, not a tuple with a starred
+                        // element:
+                        //
+                        // ```py
+                        // try:
+                        //     ...
+                        // except *exceptions, BaseException:
+                        //     ...
+                        // ```
+                        //
+                        // And this case is an outright `SyntaxError`:
+                        //
+                        // ```py
+                        // try:
+                        //     ...
+                        // except BaseException, *exceptions:  # SyntaxError
+                        //     ...
+                        // ```
                         Some(Expr::Tuple(tuple))
                             if f.options().target_version() >= PythonVersion::PY314
-                                && name.is_none() =>
+                                && name.is_none()
+                                && !tuple.iter().any(Expr::is_starred_expr) =>
                         {
                             write!(
                                 f,

 ```

 ```

 except* (BaseException, Exception, ValueError) as e:

+
+
+# Regression tests for https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff/issues/23125
